header.logout_notify: You are logged out of your account

rules.text:
It is important to follow the marking rules and write the following elements correctly: “Preview”, “Title”, “Tags” and “Text”. Here's how to properly design each of them:
“Preview”: The corresponding preview of the picture being reviewed. Here you should provide a short description or overview of the picture that will be used as a preview.
“Title”: “Title” should be written in quotation marks, and it is advisable to indicate the year of release. Also in this field you can indicate how much the user rates this object.
For example:
“Movie title” (2021) - Rating: 9/10.
“Tags”: Tags should be separated by spaces or commas. For example: tag1 tag2 tag3 or tag1, tag2, tag3. Tags help categorize and organize content for easy searching and navigation.
“Text”: Here you should provide a clear review or recommendation based on the opinion of the recommender. Your text should be informative, understandable, and useful to other users who will read the review.
Following these marking guidelines and formatting each element correctly will help create a pleasant reading experience for other users and provide easier navigation and search on your site.< /strong>
